Package com.hotels.styx.api

A programming interface for Styx extensions.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Clock
    A clock providing access to the current instant.
    Environment
    Styx application Environment.
    FullHttpMessage
    All behaviour common to both full requests and full responses.
    HttpHandler
    Handles an HttpRequest, returning an StyxObservable that is expected to publish a single HttpResponse value.
    HttpInterceptor
    An interceptor can interact with a request before it is passed to the handler and/or the response from the handler before it is returned.
    HttpInterceptor.Chain
    Coordinates the propagation of request and response through a chain of interceptors and back.
    HttpInterceptor.Context
    Context.
    Identifiable
    Indicates that an object has an id associated with it.
    MetricRegistry
    A registry for collecting all metrics.
    Resource
    Interface for a resource descriptor that abstracts from the actual type of underlying resource, such as a file or class path resource.
    StreamingHttpMessage
    All behaviour common to both streaming requests and streaming responses.
    StyxLifecycleListener
    Listener for Styx plugin lifecycle events.
    StyxObservable<T>
    Exposes a transformation API for HTTP interceptors.

    Class Description
    Announcer<T extends EventListener>
    A listener that propagates events to a list of event listeners that can be added or removed after the Announcer is constructed.

    Custom HTTP response status codes.

    Requests as many event from upstream as possible (i.e.

    Provides a representation of Form Url Encoded parameters extracted from an HttpRequest.

    HTTP request with a fully aggregated/decoded body.

    FullHttpResponse
    HTTP response with a fully aggregated/decoded body.
    FullHttpResponse.Builder
    Builder.
    HttpHeader
    Represents the key to value relationship in an HTTP header.
    HttpHeaderNames
    Provides optimized constants for the standard HTTP header names.
    HttpHeaders
    Represent a collection of HttpHeaders from a single HTTP message.
    HttpHeaders.Builder
    Builds headers.
    HttpHeaderValues
    Provides optimized constants for the standard HTTP header values.
    HttpMessageSupport
    Contains static methods for inspecting different properties of HTTP requests.
    HttpMethod
    Provides constants for HTTP Methods.
    HttpRequest
    HTTP request with a fully aggregated/decoded body.
    HttpRequest.Builder
    Builder.
    HttpResponse
    HTTP response with a fully aggregated/decoded body.
    HttpResponse.Builder
    Builder.
    HttpResponseStatus
    Contains all HTTP response status codes as HttpResponseStatus constants, as well as a method to go from a code to its name.
    HttpVersion
    HTTP Version.
    Id
    An identifier.
    RequestCookie
    Represents an HTTP cookie as sent in the Cookie header of an HTTP request.
    ResponseCookie
    Represents an HTTP cookie as sent in the Set-Cookie header.
    ResponseCookie.Builder
    Builds response cookie.
    Url
    Alternate implementation for java.net.URL for easing its usage.
    Url.Authority
    Authority part of a url string.
    Url.Builder
    Builder for Url instances.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    ContentOverflowException
    An exception that indicates that a content-aggregation operation exceeded the maximum permitted amount of content.
    NoServiceConfiguredException
    An exception thrown when there are no backend services configured for a particular path.

Package com.hotels.styx.api Description

A programming interface for Styx extensions. This includes a Styx HttpInterceptor interface for intercepting HTTP traffic, and classes to represent HTTP Request and Response messages.

Styx exposes intercepted traffic to custom extensions via HttpInterceptor class.

The intercepted live traffic is represented as HttpRequest and HttpResponse classes.

The API also has aggregated FullHttpRequest and FullHttpResponse classes. They are useful for most situations apart from intercepting live traffic.
